**Borgnjor's Vile Clutch**, also known as **BVC** and **zombie hands**, is a level 5 Necromancy/Earth spell that affects all enemies in a beam-targeted line with the [constriction](/Constriction "Constriction") status (displayed as "constricted by zombie hands").

Constriction deals damage over time until the affected monster(s) die, escape constriction (which they must waste turns to do), or the effect runs out. In most cases, the monster will die or escape before the status runs out. If you leave [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight") of any affected enemies, they are immediately released.

## Resistant Enemies

Only a small number of monsters are not affected by BVC, all of which are also immune to regular types of constriction. They include:

- [All slimes and jellies](/List_of_jellies "List of jellies").
- [Insubstantial](/Category:Insubstantial_monsters "Category:Insubstantial monsters") enemies, including [wraith](/Wraith "Wraith")-type [undead](/Undead "Undead"), many monsters in [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss"), and [orbs of fire](/Orbs_of_fire "Orbs of fire").
- [Spiny](/Spiny "Spiny") enemies

Enemies over [deep water](/Deep_water "Deep water") or [lava](/Lava "Lava") are unaffected.

## Strategy

BVC is a very versatile spell: You basically now have access to an unlimited number of [throwing nets](/Throwing_net "Throwing net") that cannot only pin but even kill a large number of enemies in a few casts, and has a few specific benefits:

- Cannot be dodged and is largely irresistible (except for creatures listed above).
- Significantly reduces the target's EV, making them easier to hit with melee or other destructive spells. This combos well with other [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic") spells, like [Iron Shot](/Iron_Shot "Iron Shot") or [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear"), which both suffer somewhat from low accuracy.
- Pins the target in place, allowing the player to move away even from fast enemies without [attacks of opportunity](/Attacks_of_opportunity "Attacks of opportunity").
- Makes the target waste turns trying to escape, similar to nets. Enemies that can reach you will still attack you in melee, but this means BVC's effect will last longer since they're no longer trying to escape. Casters can still cast spells, but at their usual rate - they generally won't cast for every single turn.
- Destroys whole groups of enemies in corridors, since it affects the whole beam path. Other piercing attacks, like [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin"), work well in conjunction.
- Note that unlike [throwing nets](/Throwing_net "Throwing net"), BVC doesn't provide an opportunity for [stabbing](/Stab "Stab") attacks.

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), BVC's base damage was `2d(3.5 + pow/20)` per turn. Also, you couldn't constrict [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible") enemies if you didn't have [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible").
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), a few more monsters were spiny - [porcupines](/Porcupine "Porcupine"), [torturous demonspawn](/Torturous_demonspawn "Torturous demonspawn"), and [hell sentinels](/Hell_sentinel "Hell sentinel") - and thus immune to constriction.
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), BVC affected a smite-targeted 3x3 area instead of a beam path.
- Prior to [0.22](/0.22 "0.22"), [Necromancers](/Necromancer "Necromancer") started with BVC, and it did 33% more damage.
- The spell was added in [0.21](/0.21 "0.21").

Borgnjor's Vile Clutch, also known as BVC and zombie hands, is a level 5 Necromancy/Earth spell that affects all enemies in a beam-targeted line with the constriction status (displayed as "constricted by zombie hands").

In most cases, the monster will die or escape before the status runs out. If you leave line of sight of any affected enemies, they are immediately released.

Resistant Enemies

Only a small number of monsters are not affected by BVC, all of which are also immune to regular types of constriction. They include:

  • All slimes and jellies.
  • Insubstantial enemies, including wraith-type undead, many monsters in the Abyss, and orbs of fire.
  • Spiny enemies

Enemies over deep water or lava are unaffected.

Strategy

BVC is a very versatile spell: You basically now have access to an unlimited number of throwing nets that cannot only pin but even kill a large number of enemies in a few casts, and has a few specific benefits:

  • Cannot be dodged and is largely irresistible (except for creatures listed above).
  • Significantly reduces the target's EV, making them easier to hit with melee or other destructive spells. This combos well with other Earth Magic spells, like Iron Shot or Lehudib's Crystal Spear, which both suffer somewhat from low accuracy.
  • Pins the target in place, allowing the player to move away even from fast enemies without attacks of opportunity.
  • Makes the target waste turns trying to escape, similar to nets. Enemies that can reach you will still attack you in melee, but this means BVC's effect will last longer since they're no longer trying to escape. Casters can still cast spells, but at their usual rate - they generally won't cast for every single turn.
  • Destroys whole groups of enemies in corridors, since it affects the whole beam path. Other piercing attacks, like javelins, work well in conjunction.
  • Note that unlike throwing nets, BVC doesn't provide an opportunity for stabbing attacks.

History

  • Prior to 0.31, BVC's base damage was 2d(3.5 + pow/20) per turn. Also, you couldn't constrict invisible enemies if you didn't have see invisible.
  • Prior to 0.26, a few more monsters were spiny - porcupines, torturous demonspawn, and hell sentinels - and thus immune to constriction.
  • Prior to 0.25, BVC affected a smite-targeted 3x3 area instead of a beam path.
  • Prior to 0.22, Necromancers started with BVC, and it did 33% more damage.
  • The spell was added in 0.21.
